com.dropbox.sync.android

Interface DbxThrowable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DbxAccountManager.ConfigurationMismatchException, DbxException, DbxException.AlreadyOpen, DbxException.Cancelled, DbxException.Disallowed, DbxException.DiskSpace, DbxException.Exists, DbxException.FileIO, DbxException.Interrupted, DbxException.InvalidOperation, DbxException.Network, DbxException.NetworkConnection, DbxException.NetworkTimeout, DbxException.NotFound, DbxException.NoThumb, DbxException.Parent, DbxException.Quota, DbxException.ReadOnly, DbxException.Request, DbxException.Response, DbxException.RetryLater, DbxException.Server, DbxException.Ssl, DbxException.Unauthorized, DbxFile.StreamExclusionException, DbxPath.InvalidPathException, DbxRuntimeException, DbxRuntimeException.AccessDenied, DbxRuntimeException.BadIndex, DbxRuntimeException.BadState, DbxRuntimeException.BadType, DbxRuntimeException.Cache, DbxRuntimeException.Closed, DbxRuntimeException.Deleted, DbxRuntimeException.IllegalArgument, DbxRuntimeException.Internal, DbxRuntimeException.Memory, DbxRuntimeException.NotCached, DbxRuntimeException.Shutdown, DbxRuntimeException.SizeLimit, DbxRuntimeException.System

    public interface DbxThrowable
    A common interface for all exceptions thrown for failures in the SDK.

    A DbxThrowable will always be an instance of either DbxException for checked exceptions, or DbxRuntimeException for unchecked exceptions. This interface allows those two types to be stored, manipulated, and re-thrown using a type more specific than Throwable (which could violate exception specifications).

    Some methods here are duplicated from Throwable for convenience. Cast to (Throwable) to use methods not provided here.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Throwable getCause()
      Gets the cause of this exception, as with the Throwable method.
      java.lang.String getMessage()
      Gets the failure message, as with the Throwable method.
      void rethrow()
      Re-throws this instance, which will always be either a DbxException or an unchecked DbxRuntimeException.

    • Method Detail

      • rethrow

        void rethrow()
             throws DbxException,
                    DbxRuntimeException
        Re-throws this instance, which will always be either a DbxException or an unchecked DbxRuntimeException.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if this instance represents a checked exception.
        DbxRuntimeException - if this instance represents an unchecked exception.

      • getMessage

        java.lang.String getMessage()
        Gets the failure message, as with the Throwable method.

      • getCause

        java.lang.Throwable getCause()
        Gets the cause of this exception, as with the Throwable method.
